intro: Malpighia vertientensis, commonly known as the yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and palmate leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor, making it a valuable resource in local cuisines.
